People need to stop calling this a Telesync. 
People also need to start reading previous comments.

TS stands for Transport Stream.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_stream

This is unaltered, original, raw video and audio stream as shown on TV. Basically, there's no higher quality than this because this is the actual stream broadcasted onto TV.

TS is user friendly. The fact that it's 1080i (The 'i' meaning "Interlaced") means you need to simply use a player with a built-in Deinterlacer. Media Player Classic Home Cinema does it automatically. VLC deinterlacing can be enabled in its "Video" option(Use "Yadif" option).

This is what rippers use to encode the files you normally see. This is the source.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1080i
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_stream
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interlaced_video
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deinterlaced
So many uneducated and rude people making statements about something they don't know about. Download it because you want the broadcast, or just download a watered down, encoded copy in SD or HD.
